experience: You and Jessica both know Robert  A. Pasionek, Michael Peters, and 25 others

S.E.E.K. Arizona is a integrated health agency that provides therapies and services to children and young adults with developmental and behavioral disabilities in Arizona.  We specialize in therapies (OT, PT, SLP, and Counseling), behavior analytic programming (BCBAs, RBTs, behavior coaches), early intensive behavioral intervention (EIBI) & life skills classrooms, and direct care supports (habilitation, respite, and attendant care) and contract with a variety of funding sources including Mercy Maricopa Integrated Care, the Division of Developmental Disabilities, Mercy Care Plan, and a variety of AHCCCS and commercial insurance plans.

The Foundation for Exceptional Kids is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit corporation that was founded in 2006 to provide educational programs and therapeutic supports to children with developmental disabilities and their families. In recent years, we have expanded our mission and initiatives to include uniting and strengthening the special needs community and the professionals that serve it.The Foundation for Exceptional Kids' mission is dedicated to improving the quality of life for children with developmental disabilities and strengthening the local special needs community.  We provide educational programs that empower families, contribute to community supports and services, and create nourishing events that unite a community.
Girl Scouts Arizona Cactus Pine Council
Led a troop of girls with special needs where the the goal of the troop was integrating them with peers at Council and community events.
Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS)

recommendations: Brian Pfingstl, MA, BCBA
April 14, 2014, Jessica managed Brian directly

Over the past six years, Mr. Pfingstl has been invaluable to our team and integral in helping me build the company.  When he joined our team, S.E.E.K. Arizona, a health and human services company specializing in autism-related services, was just a fledgling company with one clinic location and an administrative team of five.  With Mr. Pfingstl’s undying dedication to see my vision through and his impeccable business acumen, he has been instrumental in much more than the solidification of S.E.E.K. Arizona’s fiscal fitness and expansion of programmatic reach.  His leadership skills have afforded us the ability to provide support across the Greater Phoenix Metro area through three locations, and a team of over 175 employees.  His efforts have been key in propelling our company from a small, to mid-sized competitor in the fields of behavioral health and disability support services locally.Mr. Pfingstl’s excellent leadership skills and high level of expertise in the fields of developmental disabilities and behavioral health make him a key executive in any organization and position him as an excellent candidate for a wide scope of future business and leadership endeavors.Jessica Irwin, CEO, S.E.E.K. Arizona

Tom Schramski PhD, CMAA
A New Kind Of Healthcare M+A Firm
June 6, 2011, Jessica was a client of Tom Schramski’s

Tom’s professional acumen is without question, and his vita suggests a shrewd and thoughtful approach to a company’s management, development, and supervision.  Decades of experience—coupled with a genuine humanistic approach to business, employees, and clients—made Tom the perfect fit to assist in our retooling of current practices.  He is sensitive to diverse management styles and personalities, and attempts to guide those he consults using an introspective approach.  Both my partner and I use Tom’s guidance as a personal roadmap for consideration as we decide approaches that best suit our respective styles.S.E.E.K. Arizona has gained much in our few months of working with Tom as he quickly and effectively targeted areas to improve upon and provided a framework in which to do so.   We look forward to maintaining a professional and personal relationship with Tom, and would not hesitate to utilize his services as future needs arise.  In addition, I enthusiastically recommend Tom Schramski to any individuals or companies needing an experienced, active consultant to analyze current needs and future opportunities for growth.

summary: Ms. Irwin enjoys overseeing the senior-level staff and financial obligations of S.E.E.K. Arizona, while providing clinical direction and behavioral strategies for RBHA-funded clients. As a behavior analyst, she enjoys collaborating and networking with other agencies in the Phoenix-metropolitan area to ensure clients have greater access to evidence-based treatment opportunities.
name: Jessica Irwin, M.Ed., BCBA
title: CEO and Founder at S.E.E.K. Arizona
